trans-unit.source: The DsmlRequestDocument class enables you to build a DSML request payload, such as <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AddRequest"></xref>, <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ModifyRequest"></xref>, or <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest"></xref>.
It contains zero or more <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> derived objects.
The user may add, delete, modify, and enumerate the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> before sending to the server.
DsmlRequestDocument can be used with any DSML Binding classes to transport the document, such as <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection"></xref>.
The DsmlRequestDocument constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> class.
This constructor creates an empty request document.
The Add method adds a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object to the collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object to add to the collection.

The index of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> collection at which the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object was added.
request is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
The Clear method removes all items from this collection.

The Contains method determines whether this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> collection contains the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object for which to search.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object is part of the collection; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, otherwise.

The CopyTo method copies the entire <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
A one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> object.
The zero-based index of `value` where copying begins.
The Count property contains the number of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> objects in this collection.
The number of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> objects in this collection.

The DocumentProcessing property contains one of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlDocumentProcessing"></xref> that specifies how the elements of the collection are processed.
One of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlDocumentProcessing"></xref> that specifies how the elements of the collection are processed.
value is an invalid enumeration value.
The ErrorProcessing property contains one of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorProcessing"></xref> that specifies how errors are processed.
One of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorProcessing"></xref> that specifies how errors are processed.
value is an invalid enumeration value.
The GetEnumerator method returns an enumerator for the entire <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> collection.
A <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> object for the entire collection.

The IndexOf method returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object for which the index is returned.
The index value of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object, if found; otherwise, -1.
value is reference ( in Visual Basic).

The Insert method inserts the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object into the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> collection at the specified index.
The index in the collection at which to insert the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object to be inserted into the collection.
value is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
The IsFixedSize property contains a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> has a fixed size.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The IsReadOnly property contains a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> is read only or not.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> is read only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The IsSynchronized property contains a value that indicates whether access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> is synchronized (thread-safe).

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> is synchronized (thread-safe); otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The Item property contains the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object at the specified index.
The zero-based index value at which the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object is found.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object at the specified index.
index is set to a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
The Remove method removes the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object from the collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object to remove.
value is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
The RemoveAt method removes the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object at the specified position.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object to remove.
The RequestId property contains the RequestID associated with the .
The RequestID associated with the .
The ResponseOrder property contains one of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseOrder"></xref> that specifies the order of the response.
One of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseOrder"></xref> that specifies the order of the response.
value is an invalid enumeration value.
The SyncRoot property contains an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref>.
Derived classes can provide synchronized versions of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument> using the SyncRoot property.

The synchronizing code must perform operations on the SyncRoot of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument>, not directly on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument>.
This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects.
Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument> object.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref>.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo*> method copies the entire <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
A one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> object.
The zero-based index of `value` where copying begins.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.ICollection.Count*> property gets the number of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> objects in this collection.
The number of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> objects.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized*> property gets a value that indicates whether access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> is synchronized (thread-safe).

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> is synchronized (thread-safe); otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot*> property gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref>.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref>.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.IList.Add*> method adds a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object to the collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object to add to the collection.

The index of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> collection at which the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object was added.
request is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
request is not a object.
The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.IList.Clear*> method removes all items from the collection.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.IList.Contains*> method determines whether this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> collection contains the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object for which to search.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object is part of the collection; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, otherwise.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.IList.IndexOf*> method returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object for which the index is returned.
The index value of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object, if found; otherwise, -1.
value is reference ( in Visual Basic).

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.IList.Insert*> method inserts the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object into the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> collection at the specified index.
The index in the collection at which to insert the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object to be inserted into the collection.
value is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
value is not a object.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize*> property gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> has a fixed size.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly*> property gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> is read-only or not.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> is read only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.IList.Item*> property gets or sets the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object at the specified index.
The zero-based index value at which the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object is found.
The object at the specified index.
index is set to a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
value is not a object.

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.IList.Remove*> method removes the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object from the collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object to remove.
value is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument.System.Collections.IList.RemoveAt*> method removes the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object at the specified position.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object to remove.
The ToXml method transforms each <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object in the collection into an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.
The transformed <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.
